intro: Liabum bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian liabum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
